alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 9:27PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lubbock, northwestern Lynn, southwestern Floyd, northeastern Terry, northwestern Crosby, southeastern Hockley and southern Hale Counties through 1015 PM CST... At 926 PM CST, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from 7 miles southeast of Spade to 6 miles southwest of Brownfield. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Brownfield, Slaton, Abernathy, Tahoka, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Petersburg, Ransom Canyon, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Woodrow, Reese Center, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, New Deal, Meadow and Wilson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Crosby; Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry
